name: Montaron the Evil Halfling (Rogue 16/ Fighter 6/ Assassin 18)
author: Stagmeister

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Another one from the Baldur's Gate canon for you. This time it's the loyal companion and friend of Xzar, as can be seen from their comradely exchange, Xzar: "Montaron, you are so aggravating!" Monty: "Go suck yer blade."

The intrepid, if evil, Zhents are the first companions (other than Imoen, of course) you can recruit, not far from Gorion's final resting place, though you are warned of their "questionable" morality before going to say hello to the pair. Travelling with them will bring some...interesting...reactions from other NPCs, mostly comedic in nature, though there really is nothing funny about a deranged necromancer and an amoral killer.



As someone with very limited experience of the Assassin class, Max's guidance was invaluable here, and Monty has even passed muster with our killer-in-residence, Mick Dagger, so I feel less worried about presenting him to the Guild. So here the little bastard is...

I occasionally travelled with them until just after clearing the Nashkel Mines, which I normally do around level 4 - mostly for shits and giggles, tbh - but since I added a new mod, if you have Kivan with you as well, the first time the 3 of them bed down for the night, the Ranger and the Assassin have a right-royal set-to (Monty's polishing and sharpening his tools of torture, and Kivan's wife was tortured before she was killed, so...) and you have to pick a side. Pick Kiv and the other two bugger off, and vice versa. So they tend not to stay around for long these days, 'cause I do like Mr Shooty. Essentially, now I just recruit 'em, nick their gear, and put them on the front line when we first enter the Friendly Arm.

And then there's the BG2 side quest...
